__TOC__



This week's Hug Day will focus on '''Network Manager'''! 

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your '''Launchpad Id''' in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged. 

=== Tools ===

For doing your work easier during the hug days remember to use the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Tools|hugday-tools]]</nowiki>.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

To sign up for 5-A-Day participation, please add your Launchpad ID to the Participants column. (This is not the email address you used for signing up for LP, but the last part of the URL that https://launchpad.net/people/+me redirects you to (everything behind the ~ sign)):

1. Click on https://launchpad.net/people/+me
2. Look at the URL bar, everything behind the ~ sign is your Launchpad ID. 

Also sign up here: https://launchpad.net/~5-a-day-participants/+join

=== Stock Responses ===

NetworkManager stock response for collecting more information:

<pre>
Thanks for taking the time to report this bug and helping to make Ubuntu better.  Could you please open a terminal and execute: apport-collect <<BUGNUMBER>> ? It will attach the necessary information to this report. Also you can submit more information for it by looking to https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingNetworkManager , Thanks in advance.
</pre>

For general stock responses please see <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/Responses|Bugs/Responses]]</nowiki>.

=== Tags ===

Tagging bugs are also a good way to isolate reports, the NetworkManager product currently use these following tags:

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <rowbgcolor="#FFEBBB"> '''Tag'''
| '''Use case'''
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=driver-madwifi|`driver-madwifi`]]</nowiki>
| Bugs in which the madwifi driver is in use
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=driver-ndiswrapper|`driver-ndiswrapper`]]</nowiki>
| Bugs in which the ndiswrapper driver is in use
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=vpn|`vpn`]]</nowiki>
| Bugs related to either openvpn, vpnc or pptp network-manager vpn modules
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=encryption-wep|`encryption-wep`]]</nowiki>
| Bugs in which WEP encryption is used
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=encryption-wpa|`encryption-wpa`]]</nowiki>
| Bugs in which WPA encryption is used
|-
| <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bugs?field.tag=encryption-wpa2|`encryption-wpa2`]]</nowiki>
| Bugs in which WPA2 encryption is used
|}

If you find a report which match any of those Use cases please add the tag to it.
